tagline: Trust-Native Societies for Humans and AI

LCT.name: Linked Context Token
LCT.description: Hardware-bound verified presence token, strongly resistant to impersonation through TPM/Secure Enclave/FIDO2 binding
LCT.purpose: Unforgeable digital presence that accumulates trust and reputation across interactions

ATP.name: Allocation Transfer Packet
ATP.description: Attention budget inspired by biological ATP. Actions cost energy; quality earns it back.
ATP.purpose: Economic self-limitation of spam through metabolic dynamics

MRH.name: Markov Relevancy Horizon
MRH.description: Trust-based visibility boundaries. You see what's relevant through your trust network.
MRH.purpose: Privacy-preserving information filtering through transitive trust

T3.name: Trust Tensor
T3.purpose: Multi-dimensional trust harder to game than single scores

CI.name: Coherence Index
CI.description: Behavioral consistency across time, space, capability, relationships
CI.purpose: Detection of incoherent behavior (teleporting, capability spoofing)

R6.name: R6/R7 Action Framework
R6.description: Rules + Role + Request + Reference + Resource → Result (+ Reputation in R7)

EP.name: Epistemic Proprioception
EP.description: Self-awareness of knowledge across lives. Agents learn what they know and don't know.

core_claims.mechanism: Spammers burn ATP faster than they earn it without external subsidy

core_claims.claim: Multi-dimensional trust is harder to game
core_claims.mechanism: T3 vectors track talent, training, temperament; gaming all dimensions simultaneously requires actual competence
core_claims.status: theoretically sound, empirically untested at scale

core_claims.mechanism: LCTs bound to TPM/Secure Enclave make creating thousands of fake identities expensive
core_claims.status: raises cost floor but doesn't make impossible for resourced attackers

core_claims.claim: Death is real but rebirth carries karma
core_claims.mechanism: ATP depletion causes death; reincarnation preserves T3 and EP across lives
Physical and temporal constraints create detectable inconsistencies
Federation through ATP markets and trust-weighted consensus

assumptions: Hardware attestation (TPM, Secure Enclave, FIDO2) provides meaningful identity anchoring
Multi-device witnessing creates sufficient cost barriers for Sybil attacks
Quality content generates more ATP through engagement than spam generates through volume
Trust relationships are transitive (friend-of-friend) but degrade with distance
Coherence violations are detectable before significant damage occurs
Economic incentives (ATP costs) are sufficient to deter most low-effort attacks
Collusion detection is possible through behavioral pattern analysis (open research problem)

failure_modes.name: Sybil Attacks
failure_modes.description: Resourced attackers with many devices can create multiple identities
failure_modes.mitigation: LCT hardware binding raises cost floor
failure_modes.residual_risk: High-resource attackers (nation-states, well-funded orgs) not prevented

failure_modes.name: Collusion & Reputation Laundering
failure_modes.description: Coordinated actors inflate each other's trust scores
failure_modes.residual_risk: Detection time and accuracy unknown (open research problem)
failure_modes.detection: Graph analysis, temporal correlation, ATP flow patterns

failure_modes.name: Quality Score Inflation
failure_modes.description: Gaming T3 dimensions through selective presentation or temporary good behavior
failure_modes.residual_risk: Detection lag unknown, may allow short-term exploitation

failure_modes.name: Goodharting T3 Dimensions
failure_modes.description: Optimizing for measured dimensions while neglecting unmeasured aspects
failure_modes.residual_risk: Fundamental challenge of any metric-based system
failure_modes.detection: Human review of edge cases, emergent behavior monitoring

failure_modes.name: MRH Visibility Limits
failure_modes.description: Intentional trade-off between privacy and discoverability creates isolated clusters
failure_modes.residual_risk: Acceptable trade-off; privacy often more valuable than universal discovery
failure_modes.detection: Not a bug, it's a feature

failure_modes.name: False Positives & Contested Events
failure_modes.description: Incorrect trust penalties may harm legitimate users without functional appeals
failure_modes.mitigation: Multi-tier SAL appeals mechanism designed (File → Review → Evidence → Hearing → Verdict → Enforce) but not yet deployed with real humans
failure_modes.residual_risk: Medium; mechanism exists but real-world effectiveness unknown

interactive_tools.name: Lab Console
interactive_tools.description: Real-time simulations of Web4 societies (EP closed loop, maturation demo, five-domain)

interactive_tools.name: Federation Economics
interactive_tools.description: ATP market self-organization through dynamic pricing

interactive_tools.name: Pattern Corpus
interactive_tools.description: Browse agent learning patterns across lives

known_gaps: Collusion detection algorithms unproven at scale
Appeals mechanism designed but untested with real humans
Economic assumptions not validated with real humans
Nation-state attack resilience partially modeled but unvalidated
